inputs.value: Redshift cluster data is not encrypted
inputs.name: display_name

inputs.value: Redshift cluster data in the affected cluster is not encrypted at rest.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: To encrypt the data in all your user-created tables, you can enable cluster encryption when you launch the cluster.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: Connections to Redshift not required to use SSL encryption
inputs.name: display_name

inputs.value: Connections to Redshift aren't set to require the use of SSL encryption.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Enable Redshift to require the use of SSL encrypted connections.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: Redshift automatic major version upgrades not enabled
inputs.name: display_name

inputs.value: Redshift automatic major version upgrades not enabled.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Enable major version upgrades by setting Allow Version Upgrade to true. This will allow major version upgrades to be applied automatically to the cluster during the maintenance window.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: The affected Redshift cluster is publicly accessible to the world.
inputs.name: description

inputs.value: Consider whether the affected Redshift cluster should be publicly accessible to the world. If not, modify the option which enables your Redshift cluster to become publicly accessible.
inputs.name: suggested_action

inputs.value: Redshift user activity logging is disabled
inputs.name: display_name

inputs.value: Redshift user activity logging is disabled.
inputs.name: description
